intro: Sciodaphyllum digitatum, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in a spiral pattern along its stems. The plant produces tiny, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which consume the fleshy, yellowish berries. Sciodaphyllum digitatum is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
